kit101

Class ArrayRoutines

  • java.lang.Object
    • kit101.ArrayRoutines

  • public class ArrayRoutines
extends java.lang.Object
    ArrayRoutines: A collection of class methods to deal with arrays, duplicating some of the methods in java.util.Arrays (all the better to see that the code in that class isn't magic!).

    All methods in this class are static, similar to the way utility methods in java.util.Arrays are declared, so you don't need to create an object of this class to use them.

    See Also:
    Arrays

      Sorts the array into ascending order using insertion sort.

      Sorts the array into lexicographic (alphabetical) order using insertion sort.

      Performs a linear search for the location of a value in the array; returns -1 if it is not present.

      Sorts the array into ascending order using selection sort.

      Enables or disables tracing.

      Returns the sum of all elements in an array of integers.
      static void trace(java.lang.String message)

    • Method Detail

      • linearSearch

        public static int linearSearch(int[] data,
                               int target)
        Performs a linear search for the location of a value in the array; returns -1 if it is not present. See, e.g., the Wikipedia article.
        Parameters:
        data - the array to search
        target - the target to search for
        Returns:
        the position of target in data, or -1 if not found

      • binarySearch

        public static int binarySearch(int[] data,
                               int target)
        Performs a binary search to find the position of the value t; returns -1 if it is not in the array. See, e.g., the Wikipedia article.
        Parameters:
        data - the array to search
        target - the target value to find
        Returns:
        the position of target in data, or -1 if not found

      • insertionSort

        public static void insertionSort(int[] data)
        Sorts the array into ascending order using insertion sort. See, e.g., the Wikipedia article.
        Parameters:
        data - the array to sort

        Parameters:
        data - the array to sort

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • add

        public static int add(int[] a,
                      int count,
                      int value)
        Insert value in next "empty" slot in array, given the current number of entries in the array; returns the new number of filled positions. Does not add anything if the array is full.
        Parameters:
        a - the array
        count - the current number of "filled" spots in the array
        value - the value to be added to the array
        Returns:
        the new number of items in the array

      • change

        public static void change(int[] a,
                          int index,
                          int replacement)
        Sets the value in the array at position index to the given replacement value. Demonstrates that changes to array argument elements persist after the method is finished. (Serves no other practical purpose.)
        Parameters:
        a - the array to modify
        index - the position to modify
        replacement - the value to copy into a[index]

      • trace

        public static void trace(java.lang.String message)
        Prints a tracing message (prefixed by 'ArrayRoutines: ') if tracing is enabled.
        Parameters:
        message - the tracing message

      • setTracing

        public static void setTracing(boolean on)
        Enables or disables tracing.
